results.title: It's like that
results.creator_credit: Dell Stewart, Diana Ward, Elizabeth McLennan, Emma Kelly, Justine Wallace, Kate Matthews, Louise Craddock, Nicole McKinnon, Sally Gross, Sharon Parker, Sophie Raymond, Susan Earl, Yuki Wada and Southern Ladies Animation Group
results.brief_description: This beautifully moving and poignant film depicts the plight and emotions of children held in Australian mandatory detention centres, seeking refugee status. Over a series of evocative animated images, one hears an array of children’s voices, describing their experiences of migrating from overseas and their detention in Australia. The children depicted as caged, migratory birds, reflect upon their environment, treatment and future. These interviews, conducted with three children being held in centres, clearly express the trauma of their experiences (both journeying to and once in Australia) and are heart-rending in their evocation of innocence abused. On completion of this film, in October 2003, these children remained in mandatory detention, awaiting their claims for refugee status to be processed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dell Stewart, Diana Ward, Elizabeth McLennan, Emma Kelly, Justine Wallace, Kate Matthews, Louise Craddock, Nicole McKinnon, Sally Gross, Sharon Parker, Sophie Raymond, Susan Earl, Yuki Wada and Southern Ladies Animation Group

results.title: It's just something kids do (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar and La Trobe University Media Centre
results.brief_description: Studies the effects of urbanisation on children’s play. Looks at the growth of adventure playgrounds and explains how they fall short of their counterparts in European countries. Furthermore, they are not a substitute for the natural environment.

results.title: It's just better
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Margaret Pettigrew and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Mugs, mitts and toothbrushes hang from their respective nails, awaiting ten pairs of hands. At the farmhouse on Cape Breton Island where Shawn Peter Dwyer, age ten, lives with his mother and nine brothers and sisters, a team effort keeps the family functioning. The children work and play together. Their pockets are usually empty, but their lives are well filled. A useful film for the study of values and lifestyles.

results.title: It's in your power
results.brief_description: Designed to help farmers overcome some of the problems confronting their industry and the use and benefits of hand held electric tools in agriculture. Some methods of training in the use of the tools are shown during a visit to the Lackham School of Agriculture, Wiltshire; illustrates practical applications of these lessons with the tools in service arund the farm.

results.title: It's in the cards
results.brief_description: An industrial safety film for users of electical power machines. Teaches the importance and lifesaving value of “HOLD” cards. By putting this card on the main power switch of any machine, the repairman or worker assures himself that on-one will put the power on as long as the “HOLD” card hangs.

results.title: It's easy to criticize (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Peter Johnson and Panorama Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with the isolation many migrants feel when they are unable to communicate their difficulties and problems to Australians, especially those in authority. To help with these problems they have established their own clubs, where they can share their own language. Recently the New South Wales Government has established the Ethnic Affairs Commission to deal with migrant affairs and welfare.

results.title: It's easier in the country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chequerboard”.
One of a series of films which looks at the lives of children growing up in different environments. Investigates the idea that the country is the best place to rear children by looking at the lives of two boys from different country backgrounds.

results.title: It's different today
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description: This is a general recruiting film for the Royal Australina Navy. A young seaman waiting to join his ship is regaled by an old sailor with a discussion on ‘how things used to be when I was young’ intercut with action shots of navy manouvres and training exercises.

results.title: It's all man-made
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, James Archibald, Central Office of Information and Department of Environment
results.brief_description: Traces the impact of man’s industrial pursuits on the environment, focusing on the United Kingdom, and how industrialisation can work side-by-side with improving the natural landscape. Commentary by Ian Morrison.

results.title: It's about time
results.creator_credit: Danny Carter and British Information Services
results.brief_description: This film presents some extravagant or unusually designed historic time-pieces. Captures the ingenuity of horologists and craftsmen seen at work in a large factory producing clocks and watches on a mass production line. Commentary by Frank Hawkins.
